definition: home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already

sentences.english: It was to let him see his future inheritance.
sentences.chinese: 我只是想让他看看他的家业。

sentences.english: The collective wealth has been accumulated bit by bit.
sentences.chinese: 集体的家业是一点一滴地积攒起来的。

sentences.english: All my desired was to aggrandize my estate.
sentences.chinese: 我所希望的只是扩充我的家业。

sentences.english: Selling their possessions and goods, they gave to anyone as he had need.
sentences.chinese: 并且卖了田产家业，照各人所需用的分给各人。

sentences.english: Your family estates of owner piece, sooner or later wants to hand over in the your son's hand of.
sentences.chinese: 张老板你的家业，迟早要交到令郎手上的嘛。

sentences.english: Jin Duolu is save family property, promise marriage actively.
sentences.chinese: 金多禄为救家业，主动答应亲事。

sentences.english: They came to this country and built up the family business.
sentences.chinese: 他们来到这个国家，逐步建立了这份家业。

sentences.english: As long for having fair can behind my Lao each family industry, old second, do anew how?
sentences.chinese: 只要有才能继我劳家家业，老二来做又怎么了？

sentences.english: And sold their possessions and goods, and parted them to all men, as every man had need.
sentences.chinese: 并且卖了田产家业，照各人所需用的分给各人。

sentences.english: All he desired was to aggrandize his estate.
sentences.chinese: 他所希望的只是扩充他的家业。

sentences.english: And the younger of them said to his father, Father, give me the portion of goods that falleth to me.
sentences.chinese: 小儿子对父亲说，父亲，请你把我应得的家业分给我。

definition: splendor shines on the family's door (idiom)/fig. to bring honor to one's family
lit. just sitting and eating, one can deplete even a mountain of wealth (idiom)/fig. to spend one's money without generating any income
family livelihood/a household's economic situation/family property
the Zhou family (household, firm etc)/Jow-Ga Kung Fu - Martial Art
(of status or wealth) to decline/(of buildings etc) to become dilapidated/run-down/(of plants) to wilt
